content.description:
This route starts in the crack between

Easy As Your Sister's Best Friend

and

Black Tower Crack

.  Follow the crack to a stance on a ledge, take the rounded, left-facing flake up and pass the crux moving from the steep start to easier pleasant climbing up the face to anchors for Easy as your Sister's Best Friend.

Stay far enough to the right that the bolts for Easy As Your Sister's Best Friend are out of reach.

I'd be surprised if this worthwhile route hadn't been done on TR at some time, but it appears in no guide, and we did it on gear.
content.protection: A couple #1, #2, and maybe a #3 Camalot.  Slings and smaller gear for the upper half of the route.  No bolts
content.location:
Between

Easy As Your Sister's Best Friend

and

Black Tower Crack

.

content.description: Thin edges lead into a left-slanting thin crack which is followed briefly before weaving up the face passing two horizontals and mantling onto a ledge. Rest up on the ledge and then continue along the upper face to anchors.
content.protection:
TR from bolts atop

Easy As Your Best Friends Sister
content.location:
This is the striking smooth face between

Easy As Your Best Friends Sister

and

Hard As Your Husband

.

climbs.name: Hard As Your Husband
climbs.fa: Dave LePere and Brad Singer, October 2001

content.description:
Legit variety of crack climbing. Dirty obvious OW that climbs over a tree and into a great but short solid finger crack.The pro on this climb is good, but the rock quality is not the best, but the climbing makes up for it all.

Gear/natural anchor atop.
content.protection:
Standard rack up to #6

extra runners
content.location: On the right side of the east face around the corner from Easy as your Best Friends Sister and Black Tower Crack.

climbs.name: Easy As Your Sister's Best Friend

content.description: Climb to the top of a block and make a few easy moves to reach the first bolt then head up the slab veering slightly right to the base of a headwall. Pull over a steep section on hollow jugs and wander up the highly featured slabby face to anchors on a ledge.
content.protection: 7 bolts, 2 bolt anchor/rap (shared with Black Tower Crack)
content.location:
20 feet left of

Black Tower Crack

at a slabby portion of rock.

climbs.name: Easy As Your Best Friends Sister

content.description:
Start up with good hand crack. Meander over towards the right and around the small bulge/roof and follow the thinner flake/crack system to some face climbing, bolted anchors atop.

Rating is debatable depending on size.
content.protection:
Small wires/standard rack to #3

couple runners
content.location: The dihedral corner for Black Tower Buttress on the east side. Crack to the right of Black Tower Crack is the start.

content.description: Crux below the 2nd bolt and at the roof.  Last 2 bolts are shared with Easy As Your Sister's Best Friend.
content.protection: Six bolts and gear to 3 inches. Shared anchor with Crossbow and Easy As Your Sister's Best Friend.
content.location:
Left and around the corner from

Easy As Your Sister's Best Friend

.  Start left of the small pine tree.

content.description:
Start up twin cracks with a wide section on the left and climb up about 15' or so to where the angle kicks back and jugs appear on the face to the left. Higher up another steep section is encountered just before the top.

Note: there are several second pitch options available which start from the anchors atop this route.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches (including wires), 2 bolt anchor/rap
content.location:
The obvious dihedral crack right of

Easy As Your Sister's Best Friend

.
